transcripts.prompt: Transcribe this image as accurately as possible. Only include the text extracted from the document
transcripts.message:
State of New York
Montgomery S.S.
	Margaret Zimmerman being duly Sworn deposith & Saith that She is quethhy pesuoded that She was acquinted with Henry Hoven and Nancey Hoven at the time they were married that She was present at the Wedding and that She was also married at the Same time at my father’s House in Minden in Said County and that Pominic Beal performed the Marriage Cermoney on the fifteenth day of Febuary 1789 and that She knows that that Said Henry Hoven and Nancy his wife Lived together for Some time in the Same Town where She this deponant did in Said Town of Minden further Saith not.
Sworn & Subscribed before me                                                                                                                                                                     her                                                            
this 4 day of September 1838                     Margaret  X  Zimmerman
                                                                                                                      mark
John W. Raven Justice of the Peace


I John W. Raven a justice of the Peace of the Town of Minden in the County of Montgomery before, whom the above aforesaid was taken do hereby certify that I am well acquainted with Margaret Zimmerman and do know her to be a person of good Charactor for truth and veracity and her statement Entitled to credit and that She was not taught to write and did make her mark all before me Sept 4th 1838 
John, W. Raven Justice

State of New York
Montgomery County S.S
Clerks office} I Certify that John W. Raven Esq whose name is subscribed to the Jurat of the foregoing affidavit & proceeding was on the day of the date thereof a Justice of the Peace in aforesaid County of Montgomery duly Elected and qualified and that the signature to the Same is his genuine signature
                       In testimony whereof I have here unto Set my hand and affixed my official Seal this Eleventh day of September in the year 1838}
                                                                                                          A. Bownie  Clerk

transcripts.message:
State of New York
Montgomery fs. Margaret Zimmerman being duly sworn
deposeth & saith that she is aged Eighty Six years that she
was acquainted with Henry House and Nancy House at
the time they were married that she was Present at the
Wedding and that she was also Married at the same
time to my Brother House in Minden in said County
and that Dominie Bark performed the Marriage
Ceremony on the fifteenth day of February 1787 and that
she knows that the said Henry House and Nancy his
wife lived together for some time in the same house
where she this deponent did in said Town of Minden
further saith not
Sworn & Subscribed before me                   Margaret X Zimmerman
this 4th day of September 1838                                mark
John W. Haslett Justice of the Peace

I John W Haslett a Justice of the Peace of the Town
of Minden in the County of Montgomery before whom
the above affidavit was taken do hereby Certify
that I am well acquainted with Margaret Zimmerman
and do know her to be a person of good Character
for truth and veracity and her statement entitled
to Credit and that she was not taught to write and
did make her mark before me Sept 4th 1838
                                    John. W. Haslett Justice

State of New York  }
Montgomery County } Clerks Office fs I Certify that I John W Haslett Esqr whose name
is subscribed to the jurat & c of the foregoing
affidavit of proceedings was on the day of the date
thereof a Justice of the Peace in & for the County
of Montgomery duly elected and qualified
and that the signature to the same is his
Genuine signature
                                     In Witness whereof I have hereunto set
                                     my hand and affixed my official seal this eleventh day of September,
                                     in the year 1838
                                                        J J Crounse Clerk

State of New York
Montgomery

Margaret Timmerman being duly sworn deposeth & saith that she is aged sixty-two years, that she was acquainted with Henry Hover and Nancy Hover at the time they were married that she saw them at the that the also married about the same 
time at my father’s house in Mentor in said County and that Domine Real performed the marriage ceremony on the fifteenth day February 1789 and that she knows that the said Henry Hover and Nancy his wife lived together for some time in the same Town where she this deponent did in said Town of Mentor in the County of Livingston [illegible]

Sworn & subscribed before me this 4 day of September 1838 Margaret X Timmerman
her mark
John W. Taren Justice of the Peace

I John W. Taver a justice of the Peace of the Town of Mentor in the County of Montgomery before [illegible] hand was taken do hereby certify that I am well acquainted with Margaret Timmerman and do know her to be a person of good character for truth and ? and she statement entitled and that she was not taught to write and did make her mark all before me Sept 4 1838 John W. [Tever] Justice

State of New York
Montgomery County

I John W. Taren Esq. whose name is subscribed to the Jurat of the foregoing affadavit proceeding was on the day of the date therof a Justice of the Peace, in & for the County of Montgomery, duly elected and well [illegible] and [illegible] that the signature [illegible] the same is his genuine signature.

In testimony whereof I have hereunto set my hand and office this Eleventh day of September in the year 1838.

J. F. Loomis, Clerk

transcripts.message:
(Front of application)
No. 1336.
STATE OF NORTH CAROLINA,
COUNTY OF SAMpson,

On this 23rd day of February A.D. one thousand eight hundred and thirty three personally appeared before me Jno. B. Wood, a Justice of the Peace for said County, Wm. (x) Smith, aged seventy nine years, who being first duly sworn according to law doth on his oath make the following declaration in order to obtain the benefit of the provisions made by the act of Congress passed July 4th 1832 – That he was born in the county of Halifax N.C. on the 25th day of August 1753, that he enlisted into the Continental Army under Captain John Stedman (Steadman) of the State of N.C. as a private soldier in the company commanded by said Capt’n in the regiment commanded by Colo. Jno. Pyle in the Line of the State of N.C. he continued to serve in said Corps until the 25th day of December following, that he was then drafted for six months as a substitute in Captain James Kerrs Company in the same Regiment and served untill the 25th day of June 1779 at which time he was honorably discharged by his officer from said tour of duty, that he holds a discharge from both tours signed by John Pyle Colo. commandant of the Regt –

(Back of application)
That he has no record of his age or papers of any kind excepting the within mentioned discharges, which are now in possession of James D. Howell Esqr to whom I have this day delivered them for safe keeping, and that he is not able to travel or appear personally before the Department at Washington City –

Sworn to and subscribed the day and year aforesaid,

Wm. (x) Smith

And I Jno. B. Wood do hereby certify that I am well acquainted with Wm. (x) Smith who has subscribed and sworn to the above declaration that I believe him to be seventy nine years of age that he is reputed & believed in the neighborhood where he resides to have been a soldier of the Revolution, that I am not related to him nor have any interest in his claim but such as all Citizens may have.

Jno. B. Wood JP

We John (x) Howe and John (x) Suggs both being inhabitants of this County and personally knowing Wm. (x) Smith do hereby certify that we believe him to be seventy nine years of age, that he is reputed & believed in the neighborhood where he resides to have been a soldier of the Revolution –

John (x) Howe
John (x) Suggs

(Note: The text on the image appears to be of high quality and is generally clear and legible. I did not encounter any illegible or unclear sections during transcription.)
